{{wip}}
This page lists texture [[color]]s that do not fit into any other category. Only colors that are applied to textures are listed; other colors such as [[sky]] and [[fog]] are not listed here.

== List ==

===Rendering===

[[Block|Blocks]] and [[Item|items]] in the [[Creative inventory]] have a darkened tint attached to them on ''Java Edition''. If all textures are set to {{color|#FFFFFF}}, then all items, single sided blocks, and the top faces of all other blocks, are rendered slightly darker at about 98.8% brightness {{color|#FCFCFC}}, the bottom left side of blocks at about 64.3% brightness {{color|#A4A4A4}}, and the bottom right side at 39.6% brightness {{color|#656565}}. In full brightness, blocks render at 98.8% brightness {{color|#FCFCFC}} on the top, 79.2% brightness {{color|#CACACA}} on the Z-axis, and 59.2% brightness {{color|#979797}} on the X-axis.

This is due a rendering bug: {{bug|MC-213446}} and {{bug|MC-123703}}. <!--- Prior to 1.15, {{color|#FFFFFF}} 100% for items and the tops of blocks, {{color|#A2A2A2}} 63.5% brightness for the bottom left side of blocks, and {{color|#6F6F6F}} 43.5% brightness for the bottom right side of blocks--->

===Enchanted glint===

The [[Enchantment glint|enchanted glint]] appears on the following items:
* {{ItemLink|End Crystal}}
* {{ItemLink|Enchanted Golden Apple}}
* {{ItemLink|Nether Star}}
* {{ItemLink|Bottle o' Enchanting}}
* {{ItemLink|Debug Stick}}
* [[Blocks]] and [[items]] that are [[Enchanting|enchanted]]
* All potions with effects before [[1.19.3]]

==== Experience orbs ====
[[Experience|Experience orb]] textures are mostly white, gray, and red; a gradient is applied afterward to make them green and yellow.

=== Light colors ===
When the "Render Dragon Features for Creators" [[Experiments|experiment]] is enabled in ''[[Minecraft Preview]]'', and [[Vibrant Visuals]] is enabled, all [[light]]-emitting blocks render colored lighting on the surrounding blocks. Furthermore, if point lights are enabled, some light blocks have point lighting, which is a directional light source with the same colors applied. The strength depends on the block's light level. Blocks not listed here use the default light colors.{{Info needed|What is this color?}}

=== Wolf and cat collars ===

Both [[wolf]] and [[cat]] collars use the [[Dye#Color values|dye colors]] directly one to one.

=== Other world elements ===
==== Banners ====

[[Banner|Banners]] are colored according to default [[Dye#Color values|dye colors]].

==== Beacon Beam ====

[[Beacon#Beam|Beacon beams]] are colored according to default [[Dye#Color values|dye colors]]. Without any [[Stained Glass|stained glass]], it defaults to the color for [[White Dye|white dye]].

==== Guardian beam ====
[[File:Guardian beam color.png|324px|thumb|Guardian beam color for ticks 0 to 81.]]

[[Guardian]] beams are colored based on the progress of the attack and linearly transition from {{color|#402080}} to {{color|#FFDF40}}. When the attack is past 80 ticks it causes the red color to overflow, which colors the beam {{color|#00E040}} as intended.<ref>{{bug|MC-77758|resolution=Works As Intended}}</ref>

===Dyed signs===

The text on dyed [[sign|signs]] uses the following colors.{{verify|edition=bedrock}} On signs with non-glowing ink, the colors are darkened by 60% from the values in the table. On signs with glowing ink, the colors in the table are used directly for the text, and the outline has the same darkened color as text on signs with regular ink, except for black text, which has an outline of {{color|#F0EBCC}}. Due to {{bug|MC-123703|resolution=Works as intended}}, the actual rendered colors are slightly darker.
